meanings.definition: To tie or fasten a knot in something that has already been knotted.
meanings.sent1: I had to reknot my shoelaces because they were loose.
meanings.sent2: She carefully reknot the ribbon on the gift box.
meanings.sent3: He tried to reknot the tangled headphones but ended up making it worse.
meanings.sent4: The sailor had to reknot the rope quickly to secure the boat.
meanings.sent5: Remember to reknot the thread after sewing the button.

meanings.definition: To tie a knot again in something that has come undone.
meanings.sent1: After the wind blew it away, she had to reknot her scarf.
meanings.sent2: He had to reknot the fishing line after the big fish got away.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved making a ring reknot itself.
meanings.sent4: She had to reknot the friendship bracelet that had fallen off.
meanings.sent5: The boy had to reknot his balloon string after it slipped from his hand.
